results.title: Applications of quantum computing for investigations ...
results.content:
### Concluding statements

To summarize, excited states of three phenylsulfonyl-carbazole TADF emitters used in OLED display were investigated by qEOM-VQE and VQD calculations using an active space of HOMO and LUMO on the statevector simulator and IBM Quantum devices. Calculations performed with the qEOM-VQE and VQD algorithms on the statevector simulator accurately reproduced the results from exact diagonalization and provided reliable prediction of ΔEST which are in good agreement with experiments. These results show that the qEOM-VQE and VQD algorithms are accurate and can be reliably used to develop a fundamental understanding of the relation between structural variation and energies of excited states that could aid in the design of TADF emitters. [...] Results from qEOM-VQE and VQD calculations on IBM Quantum devices show that noise significantly limits the accuracy of predicted values of excited states. The excited energies were predicted to differ from exact values by as much as 16 and 88 mHa by simulations performed with the qEOM-VQE and VQD algorithms, respectively. A new practical scheme that utilizes quantum state tomography was used to calculate excited states on quantum devices. By using this scheme, excited state energies from both qEOM-VQE and VQD calculations could be computed that are within 4 mHa of energies obtained by exact diagonalization and the corresponding singlet-triplet gaps, ΔEST, are in good agreement with experimental data. We note that our work is the first validated study of excited states using the VQD method [...] An adequate error mitigation approach must be applied to obtain an accurate ground state for use as a reference state to accurately compute excited state energies on a quantum device with the qEOM-VQE and VQD algorithms. Here we have applied the readout error mitigation and quantum state tomography techniques to ground states computed with VQE. This was followed by an examination of energies and the optimized θ parameters of the Ry Ansatz to determine whether results yielded by mitigation approaches are in good agreement with those generated by exact diagonalization.

results.content: correlation or embedding method. (96,101−108);) Of particular interest to this paper are those VQE computations that report the effectiveness of different error mitigation schemes, (56,59,60,63,64,69,73,75,79,82,83,85,88,93,94,103,105);) or that are performed on IBM devices. (41,54,55,58−60,62,65,67,69,73,74,76,78,79,82,85,87−89,92,93,95,97−105,107);) Since our computations will utilize IBM devices and performance is device-specific, (76,93,109);) comparisons with results from similar hardware are more apt. [...] We now turn to experiments on the quantum hardware. We found that the noise on IBM devices fluctuated in intensity to the point that even with error mitigation, we would observe qualitatively different results from experiments submitted just hours apart. Significant hardware drift over time has also been reported previously. (82);) In one instance, results that ran and were completed within 1 h of each other differed by −0.2 Eh due to IBM recalibrating their hardware between the experiments. This severely limited the rigor with which we could perform experiments. We also observed that when we attempted error extrapolation, for some circuits, the error upon adding additional CNOT gates led the count distribution to be further away from pure noise, violating the assumptions of the [...] An initial study using data from newer IBM devices, which replaced the ones we used while this manuscript was being finalized, suggested that PQE and VQE are comparable and can recover 90% of TFIM correlation energy with proper error mitigation and the full ansatz. A study of PQE on this newrer hardware would be highly informative.

results.title: OTI Lumionics Releases Breakthrough Algorithms for Quantum
results.content:
| Source:  OTI Lumionics    OTI Lumionics

TORONTO, June 18, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- OTI Lumionics, a leader in advanced quantum simulations and solutions for next-generation materials discovery, announces the publication of its scientific paper, “Optimization of the Qubit Coupled Cluster Ansatz on classical computers,” in the Journal of Chemical Theory and Computation (JCTC). The results mark a major advancement in the quantum computing and OLED industry, demonstrating that large-scale quantum simulations of materials can be simulated today on classical hardware with high-accuracy results. Historically, current quantum computers have struggled to achieve this capability. [...] The paper and research was conducted by VP of Materials Discovery at OTI Lumionics, Scott Genin, and researchers at OTI Lumionics, Ilya G. Ryabinkin and Seyyed Mehdi Hosseini Jenab. The full paper is available at JCTC here and at arXiv.org here.

About OTI Lumionics

OTI Lumionics develops production-ready advanced materials for best-in-class consumer electronics. OTI is the first to develop quantum computing methods for industrially relevant materials design and apply them to commercial problems. OTI is currently delivering key enabling materials for OLED displays developed using its platform to leading display manufacturers for use in next-generation consumer electronics and automotive. For more information on OTI Lumionics, visit www.otilumionics.com.

Media Contact

Erica Torres [...] "Our work demonstrates a way to bypass the limitations of today’s quantum hardware while still leveraging the powerful mathematical frameworks drawn from quantum computing," said Dr. Scott Genin, VP of Materials Discovery at OTI Lumionics. "This is a critical step in accelerating materials design pipelines, especially for OLED applications, where understanding the electronic properties of emitters at the quantum level is essential."

results.title: OTI Hybrid Quantum-Classical Framework Optimizes Circuits
results.content:
OTI’s work offers a scalable, practical solution for industrial materials discovery pipelines that need quantum precision today without waiting for fault-tolerant quantum computers. It specifically accelerates OLED R&D by simulating excited-state dynamics with greater accuracy than traditional ab initio methods. The paper’s authors include VP of Materials Discovery Scott Genin, alongside researchers Ilya G. Ryabinkin and Seyyed Mehdi Hosseini Jenab.

Read the official press release here and the full research paper via JCTC here and via arXiv here.

June 18, 2025

# OTI Lumionics Publishes Paper on Record-Setting Quantum-Inspired Algorithm for OLED Materials Simulation

OTI Lumionics has unveiled a major advancement in quantum-inspired chemistry simulations, demonstrating that highly accurate quantum electronic structure calculations can now be performed on classical hardware. The breakthrough, described in the Journal of Chemical Theory and Computation, introduces a new method for optimizing deep Qubit Coupled Cluster (QCC) circuits, allowing simulations of real-world molecules at scales previously limited to future quantum computers. [...] While quantum hardware remains constrained by qubit quality and gate fidelity, OTI’s research presents a hybrid quantum-classical framework that efficiently optimizes quantum circuits with up to 80 algorithmic qubits and over a million entangling gates. The approach enables full simulation on modest classical infrastructure—reportedly 24 CPUs in under 24 hours—covering challenging molecular targets like Ir(F₂ppy)₃, a key emitter compound in OLED displays. The result demonstrates not only computational efficiency, but also high fidelity in predicting electronic states critical for materials design.

results.title: Article in npj Computational Materials (2025)
results.content:
Machine learning for excited states

In a study published in npj Computational Materials, researchers from the Faculty of Chemistry at the University of Warsaw — Dr. Joanna Jankowska and Mikołaj Martyka, MSc — in collaboration with a team from Xiamen University, proposed a new type of neural network designed to simultaneously model multiple electronic states in molecules. The architecture of this model enables better treatment of correlations between excited electronic states while also improving accuracy for the ground state. [...] What’s next?

The proposed method represents the first step toward a universal machine learning model capable of efficiently describing molecular dynamics in excited states. Future work will focus on extending the method to more complex, photoreactive systems. In parallel, the team is working on a general-purpose model trained on large photochemical datasets, which could serve as a precise and universal predictor of molecular behavior in excited states.

Publication:

Charting electronic-state manifolds across molecules with multi-state learning and gap-driven dynamics via efficient and robust active learning  
 Mikołaj Martyka, Lina Zhang, Fuchun Ge, Yi-Fan Hou, Joanna Jankowska\, Mario Barbatti\, Pavlo O. Dral\  
 npj Computational Materials  
 (2025), DOI: 10.1038/s41524-025-01636-z [...] 27  05 2025

Photochemistry on your laptop

Simulating photophysical and photochemical processes — such as photoisomerization, intersystem crossing, or charge transfer — is essential for understanding how biological photoreceptors, solar cells, or molecular switches work. However, realistic modeling of molecular dynamics in excited states requires access to accurate information on multiple electronic potential energy surfaces and their couplings, making such simulations computationally very demanding. For years, theoretical photochemistry has been seeking a balance between accuracy and efficiency — and now, with the advent of machine learning, new opportunities are emerging in this field.

Machine learning for excited states

## Figures [...] ## Introduction

Organic luminescent materials have attracted substantial and increasing interest from academia and industry over the past decade, particularly for the fabrication of lightweight and flexible optoelectronic devices. These devices can be used in various applications, including organic light-emitting diode (OLED) displays [1,2], luminescent solar concentrators [3,4], and photocatalysts [5,6]. Although they have many potential advantages, several serious challenges must be overcome before organic luminescent materials can be commercialized.

### Quick links [...] ### Concluding statements

To summarize, excited states of three phenylsulfonyl-carbazole TADF emitters used in OLED display were investigated by qEOM-VQE and VQD calculations using an active space of HOMO and LUMO on the statevector simulator and IBM Quantum devices. Calculations performed with the qEOM-VQE and VQD algorithms on the statevector simulator accurately reproduced the results from exact diagonalization and provided reliable prediction of ΔEST which are in good agreement with experiments. These results show that the qEOM-VQE and VQD algorithms are accurate and can be reliably used to develop a fundamental understanding of the relation between structural variation and energies of excited states that could aid in the design of TADF emitters. [...] Here, we take an initial step towards the application of algorithms such as VQE, qEOM-VQE, and VQD to determine ground and excited state energies of industrially relevant molecules. The subject of this study is thermally activated delayed fluorescence (TADF) emitters suitable for organic light-emitting diode (OLED) applications9."). Once the separation between the first singlet (S1) and triplet (T1) excited states (ΔEST) of such molecules is sufficiently small, non-emissive T1 excitons can be thermally excited to an emissive S1 state, providing the emission mechanism of TADF emitters. The mechanism enables OLED devices comprised of TADF emitters to potentially perform with 100% internal quantum efficiency, in contrast to devices comprising conventional fluorophores for which the quantum

results.title: Towards Quantum Advantage in Chemistry - arXiv
results.content:
As a benchmark, we compute excited state energies of phosphorescent iridium (III) and platinum (II) complexes used in organic light-emitting diodes (OLEDs) [21, 22, 23, 24]. These complexes combine industrial importance with experimentally accessible properties, making them ideal for assessing accuracy. Our results demonstrate systematic improvements over conventional methods and establish a framework for evaluating quantum advantage in chemistry, materials, and drug discovery.

## 2 Results

### 2.1 Summary of iQCC

The iQCC method is a VQE type quantum algorithm which uses a unitary ansatz and represents a trial wave function as

# 如何评价庆应义塾大学的KMD项目？

庆应的keio media design项目具体是一个怎样的项目？我查看了一下，最近很火的创业团队的领导高磊应该是那边毕业的。

关注者

69

被浏览

76,377

#### 14 个回答

YolandaCao

慶応義塾大学和早稻田大学是日本私立大学中最好的两所。慶応偏经济，法律，医学。KMD（keio media design)成立于2008年，是一所很新的设计类研S究院，设立初衷是希望效仿美国的MIT，用创新来带动日本科技经济的发展。因此院系内的设置和一般的日本大学院分Zemi不同，是归属于project为主，project的教授就是你的主教授。project的选择完全是按照个人意愿。

目前里面现在的project有：

Global Education, Policy, Reality Media , Oikos, Creato,

KMD分四个学期。第一学期和第二学期需要上很多基础的课程。叫Pipeline 1,2,3. 里面会教授大家科技，管理，政策，设计四个方面的基础课程。同时会完成很多分组或者个人的作业。这两个学期是给大家打基础的。同时，在第一学期，根据个人意愿来选择自己要进的project.在上学期，学校会举办project 的showcase. 到时候有机会和各个project的前辈交流，来了解project的氛围和要做的事情。之后再会填报志愿。

就算进了一个project之后，发现自己不适合，也有一次机会可以修正。修正机会是在第一学期结束的时候。 [...] GIDプログラム
KMD:慶應義塾大学大学院メディアデザイン研究科
  
CEMSプログラム
  
  
  

补充：这是一篇之前在豆瓣发过的旧文，目前我已经从KMD毕业。虽然在上学的时候常常吐槽KMD，但是现在回想起来，还是有点怀念在学校的日子。庆应的国际化环境真的是在进了社会之后无比怀念的啊。

知乎用户

合过KMD，对政策管理这些领域不熟悉，单说设计+技术领域，还是有点东西的。

对于HCI，kmd搞这个的有Kai KUNZA, Kouta MINAMIZAWA, Junichi Yamaoka.

前两位的google scholar引用数也对有国内一线985水平了（本人本科某中部985引用上3000的学者就不算多）。具体到发的会议，这三位的dblp统计：

UIST,CHI,UBICOMP,IUI,TEI,SIGGRAPH(非正式文章)......这些耳熟能详的交互顶会每年都有产出，虽然很多只是posters或者demos，非会议论文，但是这也意味着跟着这些教授做东西的话大概率每年都可以跟着去这些顶会玩，开阔眼界。 其实个人认为就HCI研究而言日本第一是东大（学环的几个研究室，情理的Takeo Igarashi），第二的话应该就是keio了。(日本这个方向搞得人实在不多，也许OSAKA U和TSUKUBA U和keio并列?）其毕业的phd前辈也有直接留在庆应计算机系任教的，之前也有kmd搞技术的教授后面跳槽到了东京大学自己开研究室（稲見 昌彦），所以在技术这一块还是很有底气的。

所以，但就HCI研究而言，KMD对得上keio在日本的地位，放国内也是顶尖的平台。（国内真做HCI的组少得可怜）如果你恰好想做HCI，又想待在东京的话，KMD可以称得上是一个相当令人满意的选择。

Kansy

在东京的设计斯

4 人赞同了该回答

results.title: 庆应义塾大学（Keio University）在日本属于什么样的学校？和早稻田大...
results.content: 还有，我觉得别想些乱七八糟的比较好，keio和早大、京东全都是顶尖学校，互相比较就是98-99-100比97-100-98比96-100-99的区别，没有特别大的意义，论师资已经无法比个真正的高下了，东大京大国立研究机关是有排面，但是师资也和钱有关，私立大学有钱，东大还

results.title: SGU项目当季热申 | 庆应义塾大学GIGA项目 - 知乎
results.content:
先来说说冬季AO（Global）这期招生，其实就是原来正常招的那批每年9月SGU/英文项目方式申请入学的那一期，无笔试、无面试；不过除了英语成绩、学历证明、Essay等常规的材料之外。申请人还必须上传一段三分钟的演示视频（英语），陈述自己的申请理由，入学后的学习计划、未来目标等。这个是算是在SGU项目校中比较特殊的一个条件。

冬季AO（Global）优势总结：无笔试、无面试；无需SAT 2、AP等sub标化成绩，在这个档位的大学里要求十分友好，更多申请要求可私信咨询。

春、夏、秋3轮入试接受EJU成绩、一般采取日本现地面试（疫情期间，面试现以网络模式进行）、选择春季入学的必须要有日语能力、无笔试；非常适合已经在日本准备考学的学生。再对比常规用日语考入庆应义塾大学的流程是：一次选考书类审查，合格者再进入二次校内考，校内考包括日语小作文和面试。这么看GIGA简直开了“外挂”，开启了“抢人”大战，已经在日本现地的同学无疑多了一份选择。

①选择英语作为入试语言的同学，建议TOEFL 90+或IELTS 6.5+。

②选择日语作为入试语言的同学，建议日语能力在N1或同等水平，“英语成绩”可作为可选材料递交。

注：关于标化成绩的部分，keio官网并没有给出“最低分数”，不存在"cut-off" scores这种说法，但根据我们历年的申请经验，建议SAT1 1350以上较为稳妥。选择递交EJU成绩的，参考常规日语途径入试建议EJU 680+。

常见FAQ

Q:不同的申请期(春季AO、夏季AO、秋季AO)有何不同?

A:在筛选方法上没有区别，只是申请时间差异。

Q:不同的申请期【春季AO、夏季AO、秋季AO、冬季AO（Global）】有何不同? [...] SGU项目当季热申 | 庆应义塾大学GIGA项目

行知学园SGU

我们用英语，成就你的日本留学梦！

25 赞同

3 评论

67 收藏

> 前言：当前庆应义塾大学GIGA Program已进入2023年秋季入学冬季AO（Global）阶段的申请期。今日行知学园SGU项目组就来为大家捋捋有哪些变化。

先铺垫一下，目前庆应义塾大学本科阶段支持SGU/英文项目秋季入学申请的有：PEARL Program（经济学部）、GIGA Program（政策管理学部、环境情报学部）

关于PEARL Program（经济学部）的申请可翻阅历史文章~

GIGA Program全称：Global Information and Governance Academic Program，下设两个学部：

> 政策管理学部（Faculty of Policy Management）：政策设计，社会创新，国际战略，经营・组织，都市・地域战略分野。  
> 环境情报学部（Faculty of Environment and Information Studies）：先端情报系统，先端领域设计，先端生命科学，环境设计，人类环境科学分野。

课程目标是培养学生成为能够识别和找到解决社会上复杂的广泛问题的领导者。教师将采用综合的多学科方法，将技术，工程，数学和科学的严格课程和国际关系，发展，政治学和语言方面的强大基础课程结合起来。

根据本次GIGA发布的招生计划，开启的春、夏、秋、冬全年AO车轮战入试的方式，全年都是机会！关于4轮AO入试的区别我们也整理成了简单的表格↓ [...] Q:不同的申请期【春季AO、夏季AO、秋季AO、冬季AO（Global）】有何不同?

A：资格要求和筛选方法不同。由于不需要面试，所以不需要去日本就可以进行冬季AO (Global)的申请。对于夏季AO/秋季AO/春季AO，可以选择日语或英语作为申请语言。冬季AO (Global)只可以使用英语进行。

编辑于 2022-11-08 · 著作权归作者所有

results.title: 【日本留学】法学深造必看，SGU项目校的LL.M.阵容 - 知乎
results.content:
17 赞同

63 收藏

> 前言：“律师不是正义的化身，法律也不是惩恶扬善的工具。法律保护被害者的利益，也保护加害者的”。做一个学法的人是一份荣耀，因为我们有了用生命去守护的东西：正义。”

法是什么？法如何运行的？法的价值在哪里？法与政治、经济、文化有什么关系？法学的高度专业性注定让它只能属于一小部分人。虽然小众但不能忽视，今天和大家唠唠SGU项目校中，提供法学研究科（LL.M.）申请的大学。

目前在SGU项目校中：庆应义塾大学（私立）、早稻田大学（私立）、\神户大学（国立）、九州大学（国立）、金泽大学（国立）提供LL.M.研究科申请。\神户大学虽然不是SGU项目校，但该专业支持英文申请。

入学or申请

今天我们先来说申请期：

早稻田大学LL.M.目前仅支持春季入学九州大学LL.M.目前仅支持秋季入学神户大学LL.M.、庆应义塾大学LL.M.和金泽大学LL.M均支持春季／秋季入学

现在让我们一起来看看这几所支持LL.M.的院校申请期分别是什么时候！截止2022年9月27日，大学官网已公布的Guidebook ，供各位申请者参考：

早稻田大学LL.M.材料递交期：一般在前一年的9-10月

神户大学LL.M. 材料递交期：一般在前一年的11-12月

庆应义塾大学LL.M.材料递交期：一般在前一年的9-10月

金泽大学LL.M.材料递交期：金泽大LL.M.有2轮申请期

第一轮申请当年10月和次年4月入学，一般在当年6月递交申请

第二轮申请次年4月和10月入学，一般在当年11月递交申请该项目需套磁，获得内诺后方可提交材料。

九州大学LL.M.九州大学LL.M.项目，不设申请起始日，只设申请截止日：

2023年秋季入学截止日期：2022年12月23日

两所私立三所国立，虽然都叫LL.M.但每所大学的特色和侧重还有所有不一。

Keio LL.M [...] 两所私立三所国立，虽然都叫LL.M.但每所大学的特色和侧重还有所有不一。

Keio LL.M

先说早庆这组“法学豪华套餐”，也是平时学生和家长咨询的“大热门”，看点颇多。

2017年4月，庆应义塾大学法学院（KLS）增加了全球法律实践计划的新法律硕士（Master of Laws (LL.M.) in Global Legal Practice ）提供英语申请，这是日本私立大学法学院中的首批推出此类课程的院校之一。

如今KLS已成为日本顶级法学院之一，每年为有前途的法律专业人士提供教育。相比早大的LL.M.庆应则更侧重于商法，另外课程中有“双学位”计划，为学生提供更丰富的海外求学机会。例如和华盛顿大学法学院的双学位计划，比单独获得两个学位所需的成本更快，成本更低。

Keio LL.M.关键词：日本顶级法学院/日本第一私立/双学位机会/最快1.5年拿硕士学位

Waseda LL.M

早稻田大学法学院也被广泛认为是日本法律学习的顶级机构之一。2017年7月（留一下时间轴，几乎和庆应“你追我赶”同时开设），早稻田大学法学研究科(Waseda University Graduate School of Law)上线了全新的英语课程LL.M.（LL.M. in Asian Economic Integration and Law）最快一年就可以拿到硕士学位。

Waseda LL.M.通过提供有关亚洲经济一体化和法律的理论和实践专业知识，培训出在亚太地区及其他地区发挥作用的法律，商业和政府领导者。如果你从国际视角对法律和经济的关系感兴趣，那Waseda LL.M.可能是为你而设的。

值得一提的是该项目的学费，做过些日本留学攻略的同学会知道日本国立大学的费用都是统一的，一般国立大学硕士为两年，每年学费282000日元入学金+535800日元。 [...] 私立大学的费用则有所不一，此硕士课程最快一年就能毕业，总费用仅100多万日元，省了将近一半费用，和一半时间。该课程毕业后早大还将提供东京地区的律师事务所、公司和政府机构的实习机会。

Waseda LL.M.关键词：日本顶级法学院/最快一年拿硕士学位/学费低/提供就职机会

Kobe LL.M

神户大学是一所拥有百年以上历史的著名研究型国立综合大学。它的创立可追溯到1902年（明治35年）。神大有三个历史悠久的学部经营学部、经济学部、法学部，其毕业生得到日本社会各界的高度评价，尤其活跃在财界、经济界，常有“东一桥，西神大”的说法。

2015年4月，神户大学 LL.M. (GMAP in Law)开始了第一期招生，课程侧重国际交易法、国际投资法、国际商事仲裁等“国际商务法”，提供商业管理，商业咨询和争议管理方面的选修课。许多课程重于实践技能，包括模仿国际惯例的角色扮演和互动练习。

Kobe LL.M.关键词：国立大学/学费低/重实践/海外实习机会

Kanazawa LL.M

金泽大学法学院的起源可以追溯到1881年5月石川县成立师范学院法学院的时代。而金泽大学的历史，可以追溯到1862年的加贺藩种痘所，现在的金泽大学是1949年在合并石川师范大学，金泽医科大学，第四高等学校，金泽工业专门学校等高等学校的基础上，建立起来的一所新体制的综合性大学。

肯定有人吐槽，这么牛我怎么没听说过呢？别急，日本“七帝大”大家一定知道，代表着日本大学的顶尖实力。而金泽大学，就是那“第八所帝国大学”！

金泽大学LL.M.共有四个专业方向可供选择，更加侧重政治和纯法律，涵盖诸如法律概念、宪法，民法，刑法，法学，英美法学和法律史等课程。根据研究方向学生毕业后可取的法学硕士或者政治学硕士学位。

Kanazawa LL.M.关键词：国立大学/学费低/重实践/小组教育
